comment: 8 writing assignments (1-2 pages) and 3 exams - that's it. The class schedule was incredibly strange, work back to back some weeks and then random weeks with nothing? Instructions copied and pasted into each writing assignment, even when they don't make sense/apply. Pretty lenient grader, but non-communicative

rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: There were very few things that were graded because of that I do not recommend her for this particular course. She will not be supportive if you are going to fail and need to retest or anything of the sort.

I took Dr. Martin for my Senior Capstone, and I'm really glad I did. She took a hard class and made it less intimidating. The class itself is super straight forward with clear guidelines. 3 papers, last one you write about someone else's paper. 1 powerpoint presentation on a topic you find interesting about psychology. And discussion posts.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: I don't know what it is about this course but she is not that great. She is very condescending when people are struggling and says um every five seconds in her lectures. You have 1 quiz every 2 weeks covering 2 huge units and even though the quizzes and exams are open note, her answers are hard to find in her material. I wish she was better.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Martin was really cool, and made senior sem way less intimidating. She's not a harsh grader, and definitely seems to reward genuine effort. You basically have a topic you'll write two papers on, then write a third paper about someone else's paper, and then do a project on an assigned topic. This was a scary class and she made it easy on us.

Professor Martin was a pretty good professor. In each module there was always a lecture video, A LOT of articles to read, the textbook chapter that went with the module, and an assignment that would be due on that Friday. There were 4 tests and the fourth one was optional. The tests were hard, but the assignments were easy and repetitive.

This class was easy for me because I did the work and listened to the lectures. I didnt think the tests were too hard but some questions were tricky. The writing assignments are easy. She communicates with students and will adjust grades if a lot of people miss questions. She is a good & caring person and tried to make a connection with us!

This class was all online because of COVID. I think something was really missing because we didn't have lectures. I feel like the discussions in class with her would have been good. Nevertheless, she gives 9 weekly (small) papers. I got 100 on all of them. The tests were a little tricky, but she's not unfair. Curved one that we struggled with

She is horrible at answering emails. I emailed her on a Wed. morning and she did not get back to me until the following Mon. Her lectures are good but the tests are difficult compared to what was talked about in the lecture. There are 9 writing assignments throughout the semester, but they are easy, got a 100 on all. Not the worst but not the best.

Dr. Martin is amazing! She is so caring, and will work with you no matter what the situation. She takes feedback from students and will adjust due dates or even grades depending on what the class needs from her. She is super flexible with her students. The class is lecture heavy so you have to put in work to get the grade you want.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Overall, pretty good professor. There were 4 exams and one major paper but she dropped the the lowest score. Prof Martin is very laid back, and grades the major papers fairy easy. Go over the materials she has listed for each exam and you'll do fine.

Dr. Martin is a good teacher, she really cares about you doing well in her class. She is an easy grader. the first test is a little difficult but the rest are easy stat math questions. The paper is very important, easier to do if you have another person with you as your partner. She is very chill, and i would recommend her to anyone who wants an A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: I took her online class. The content for each module was well-organized. A lot of the information she provided was interesting, although it did require you to read a bit. It was mostly quizzes/tests, there was only 1 discussion required and no other assignments. As long as you go over the powerpoint/reading, you'll do just fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Martin is amazing! Especially for a Maymester. As long as you read through the PowerPoints a few times, do the study guides, and understand definitions (not just memorize) you'll be fine. Read through the test questions carefully. She offered extra credit on each test and drops your lowest test grade.   Funny and extremely knowledgeable!

TAKE HER! This was my first class as a Maymester and it was not as bad as I thought! There are 4 tests and she drops your lowest! You just listen to her lecture and she shows in class videos! I would definitely take her again. If you take her for Maymester you don't need to buy the book!

She is easily my favorite professor in the psych department - if not in general- and I have had a lot of really great psych professors. Very down to earth and knowledgable, keep creative discussion flowing throughout class, and the information itself is so interesting! I can say I have learned more than I expected from the class because of her.

She was awesome! Very funny and charismatic. The material was interesting and though some struggled, I found it to be pretty straight forward. She had a good mixture of power points and videos so it wasn't always impossible to pay attention. Used the book for the writing assignments due every week in APA format, not difficult. Take her! And study!

Very straight forward and down to earth. She's very helpful. 4 exams drops the lowest. If you pay attention in class and study your notes you can pass the exams w/ no problems. Never used the book. The summer 8wk course was stressful because of the time period. No room to bounce back from a unfavorable grade on an exam.

I took her for Lifespan during Maymester. It was a lot in a short amount of time, but if you're into this kinda stuff, it was so enjoyable. She's absolutely hilarious, very upfront, and very honest- all of which I respect and love. She does a great job at answering questions and getting you to think. Definitely take her if you have the chance to.

Tooke her for Maymester Lifespan and absolutely loved the class. 4 tests with lowest dropped, she also gives extra credit questions on the test. You'll do well if you pay attention, but it's pretty easy to focus because her lectures are great. Take her if you get the opportunity!

Dr. Martin was honest to God one of my favorite professors at KSU. I took Lifespan Development as a Maymester. Because it was a Maymester, it was a LOT of material thrown at you at once. There were 3 tests and a final and if you were happy with your grade after test 3, the final was optional! She's hilarious and really cares about us. TAKE HER.

If you have the chance, TAKE HER! Dr. Martin is hilarious and makes the lectures interesting. I took her for a Maymester and although we covered alot in a short period of time it wasn't terrible and her teaching style is easy to follow along. She's easy to contact and gives clear expectations of what is to be accomplished for the class.

I loved her but her tests can be hard. My advice is to start a study group and meet once a week to come up with examples for the terms she describes because her tests are in example format. I also liked her writing assignments, which there are 10 of them mostly opinion based, but they help you study for the test.

Dr. Martin is very engaging and entertaining. Even though attendance was not mandatory, I enjoyed going to class (she also only gives answers to bonus questions in class so I recommend going). For an upper level class, it was pretty easy. 4 tests-drops the lowest one, and about 10 writing assignments. Just study her powerpoints, no book needed.

Dr. Martin is by far the best psychology professor at KSU! She makes her lectures really fun and entertaining! she's super chill! Would definitely take again! I would recommend showing up to class because she'll tell you random facts in some lectures that will be extra credit questions on her exams! Highly recommend her!!!

You definitely need to attend lectures. She's animated & keeps it interesting which really helped me to retain the info & stay focused Provided real-life examples during lecture for almost every concept in the notes (on D2L) Gave a study guide for every test My advice: make list of the terms/definitions from each chapter's powerpoint as you go.

She treats this class as a 3000 level class so studying is necessary. She is so much fun in her lectures though. Psychology can be boring, but she makes the information fun so going to class isn't a chore. She just assigned writing assignments and tests and once you get the hang of the writing its not hard at all.

Hilarious! She is entertaining, but a bit fast going through powerpoints. Her tests are based on the powerpoints mostly, so study those along with the study guide and use book as reference. Writing assignments are also easy. Overall, an easy A.

I absolutely love Dr. Martin! She was my favorite this semester. You have 3 tests and a final. The final optional. All tests are cumulative, but this information is easy to remember. All ppts are online, but I recommend going to class. She gives you answers to bonus questions on the tests in class ONLY, and she's good at explaining concepts.

Very simple class just covers a lot of information so studying is mandatory to pass her tests. Her SA's help ALOT for her test, make sure you attend their sessions! Only 3 tests and final that can replace your lowest grade if needed. Her lectures are long but she adds videos and funny stories to keep you interested. Highly recommend her!

Easiest class ever. 4 exams, drops the lowest one. Final grade was the average of the 3 others. Does not take attendance. She posts all of the powerpoints online so you don't even have to go to class, but she's hilarious and made all of the lectures so interesting so it was actually fun to go. TA's had study sessions, just like the exam. TAKE HER!

Basically if she tells you your test is multiple choice, it will be mostly short answer and if she says your test will have mostly math problems and to study the formulas do not study the formulas because that means the test will not contain any and will all be multiple choice. Basically study the opposite of what she says if you wanna pass.

Loved the class! She's very knowledgeable and funny which makes the class very interesting and fun. She gave us good study guides and let us know exactly what would be on the tests. Would definitely take again and recommend her!
Loved her! Easy grader. No long papers, but you have short 1-2 page papers every two weeks on a specific topic.... She is super fun and witty

Professor Martin is hilarious. Her wit and personal stories make lectures extremely interesting and most students don't want to miss. Three tests, an optional final, and 6-7 short writings (opinion based, so easy). I learned a lot because she has a research lab where she works with children. She knows an extensive amount and puts info in easy terms

I thought going into this class that the professor was going to be awesome - she was not. She was very lackluster in her teaching. It was very hard doing a group research paper. It was miserable especially since I ended up writing the paper for my 3 group members. Hope they enjoy the A..

She was absolutely wonderful as a teacher. She was quite helpful and really laid back. I took her during the summer and received an A. We wrote a paper with 16 references and I only got 3 points taken off. She is more than willing to help and she wants you to engage with the class.

Dr. Martin's class was very interesting. She covered a lot. I had a Saturday class which meant I had to be there twice as long but the class was so interesting, it didn't seem that long.  I would say the test were comprised of 85% lecture and 15% book. There were no quizzes but we had about 4 tests that were multiple choice, a paper and a final.

Wonderful teacher! I have taken 3 classes with this professor. She really knows her stuff! Very reasonable and doesnt treat students like children. She is tough, but only because she expects quality work.

Great professor who made lectures interesting and had a great way of breaking up the final paper to make it super manageable. I was intimidated coming to Research Methods, but now I feel like I did well. Got an A (barely though) so if you put in the effort and stay on top of due dates and exams, you'll be fine. Her TA's were awesome too.
I do not recommend this class or teacher. She can be rude and overly opinionated. She also has the answer to everything. She is not organized and relies on her TAs to teach the important stuff.

Dr. Martin is awesome. She is hilarious and has so many great stories. She is passionate about her life's work and is very helpful. She seriously cares about the success and well-being of her students. I will definitely be taking Sexuality with her!
Hands down one of the best professors at KSU.

Dr. Martin is one of the most interesting and personable professors I have taken. She is not easy but fair. Her exams come almost exclusively from lecture so you do need to attend class. Also, don't expect any study guides other than your notes, and trust me there will be a books worth. If you want a challenge I highly recommend her. Final Grade: A

This was a very comprehensive class and she covered EVERYTHING. I liked the recorded lectures. They were short and easy to follow. She tested us every day (two week course) and it kept me on track. I learned a whole lot in this class.

Easy course but she's not very helpful for the online portion. She was very unorganized this semester which could have been because vista sucks. Easy B but get ready to teach yourself all of the material and don't bother e-mailing her. I knew it was an online course when I took it but I expected her to be more helpful

She made it a big deal to make sure we knew how to apply the info in the class to our lives, for grad school, etc. This made the class very helpful. This is a hard class. I got out of it what work I put into it.

I switched sections from another professor and I was so glad I took Sexuality with Dr. Martin. She brought up information I would have never thought of. She seemed committed to the class- wanting us to do well, wanting us to get what we needed to out of the class. She also seems very passionate about the topic. The workload was okay.

Do NOT take her online class, you might not want to take her class period. She was extremely disorganized, unresponsive for weeks, the lectures were frequently posted late on Vista. She is nice and curves grades but if you don't want to take chances w/your grade take someone else. Although I ended up w/an A I will NOT take her again.

Do NOT recommend as an online class unless thats all you are taking. All tests are comprehensive and spread too far apart. You will need to read and know the entire book to make a good grade. If you are looking for a quick n easy A find someone else to take. Term paper topics sent AFTER springbreak so you don't have all semester to work.

Although she is a relatively easy marker, there is a lot of work to do in her class in a very short period of time. She doesn't teach a lot, merely skims over the powerpoints because she, along with the students, want to get out early. Having her made this class easier though.

Dr. Martin is a really fun professor. I took her for 3305 and 3365 and got A's in both classes. I didn't do much studying except from the powerpoints right before tests, but I rarely missed class. Didn't use the book in either class, so don't buy it. Her questions on tests come word for word from the powerpoints so look them over!

the class is hard to begin with. she explains it better than most teachers, and she'll help you if you show you want to succeed. yes she gets off topic A LOT. assignments help boost your grade or break em, tests are easy if you study the study guide, if not the wording n test will confuse you. go to class!!!! people who go benefit in secret ways

Dr. Martin is a very caring professor but can be a bit disorganized at times. She is very much in tune with her students' feedback, is flexible and is always willing to help. You have to put forth a GREAT amount of effort in this particular class in order to succeed but she is there for you every step of the way.

I LOVE her.I have taken her twice.Her tests are hard but, duh you gotta study.Lectures are always interesting&fun.Don't txt in her class cause she will call you out. AWESOME CLASS! If you want a fun class and are willing to study take her. It is college people!

Dr. Martin is a very outgoing professor, and seems to really enjoy the subject.  She made the class fun and interesting, but I don't think I learned much because it was a hybrid class (half online) and she didn't seem to get very involved in the online portion other than posting the slides that she would have taught from in a regular lecture period

I took Dr. Martin for Developmental Psychology and had a great time! She does a great job at going over material. Tests were not difficult if you study. Remember: this is a college level course. She does tend to get a bit distracted, but it always ends in interesting life experiences about the subject.I would highly recommend her!

She seems cool but she thinks she's always right and her tests can be hard since some questions are very picky. She says she'll answer questions on the discussion board but she doesn't even read the question thoroughly b/c her answers are vague and sometimes not helpful at all. She will make fun of students if she thinks they are being ridiculous.

This class is not for the faint of heart.Material can be extremely graphic.  The textbook is not used on test hardly ever. Tests mostly off power-point and class discussions.She's helpful but,can be crass. Disorganized, but knows her subject.The textbook is rated xx.The words used in class can be offensive to some. Tests are harder than seems.

Nicole is an OK teacher but she honestly does not care about you. She is very unorganized and is never prepared. Her tests are NOT AT ALL what is covered in class. pay attention to the syllabus cause she likes to change what she initially said. dont depend on her because she does not care about her students.. i got an A but i had to work HARD

She is a very funny person and interesting to listen to. She gives many personal examples from her work experience to help better understand what she is talking about. But the tests are very hard. The study guide is a list of 200+ words for a 50 question test. Studied and made D's on the tests. Drops the lowest test grade though.
Teacher as a person - GREAT / Class sucks - 10-12 chptr each test. Test do not match up to study guide or Power Points. Study hard & still fail.

As a person she is great, laid back and even borders cool. My biggest issue with this class was that her power points were informative but her study guide and the test never matched up. She say she will take questions from the previous tests to make the final-NOPE -Study everything and anything -It's a lie I think only 2 questions were on the final

She is quite a humorous individual but at times she can be extremly rid and a lil off the wall. But I would want respect so maybe thats the y she is like that. Exams are over 6-7 chapters without study guides so u must study to pass.

I recommend Dr. Martin, especially for Lifespan/Developmental Psychology. Dr. Martin not only knows her information extremely well, she is an engaging and interesting lecturer. In my personal experience, her lectures and powerpoints were more interesting than the book and much more useful and generalizable to the real world.

AMAZING TEACHER. I loved coming to this class! All her pwpts are online, she really knows how to make the class interesting. She has 2 tests in the semes. 1/2 of final is take home cumulative, the other half is in class. One (8-10pg) paper of your choice. Hand it in early and she'll tell you what she wants. Easy A. Just STUDY. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!&#98

WOW! I loved this class and I thought Dr. Martin did a GREAT job teaching it. Her test are NOT hard IF you study BUT notice I did say STUDY. You don't need the expensive textbook to pass her class I didn't buy it and got an A! AWESOME class!! I can't say enough about it. REALLY take IT!!!! You won't REGRET it. I wish I could take her again!!!

LOVED her class! she's very smart, funny and really wants everyone to do well. If you study for her tests, you'll do really well! If not, don't expect a free pass. She's AWESOME! I will take any class she teaches!

Dr. Martin was awesome! She really enjoys her field which shows when she teaches. She's there if you need help and is very clear with what she wants you to know. Her tests can be easy if you study. If not, don't expect an A. Loved the class!
She cares so much about her students and she cares that we do well and get something out of the class. I found the class challenging. But I was happy to show up every day. Great professor.

I really enjoyed her class. She is really funny..she always starts out class with funny youtube videos. It was also very easy. 3 tests worth 300 points, a final worth 200, and attendance and participating in studies are worth 100, all out of 600. She is a texting nazi though & don't leave her class early or she'll call you out in front of everyone.

Although I'll likely fail or BARELY PASS her class, she's still a great professor.  She's funny and has a story for everything.  And she def knows the material!  Just be sure that you find the best way for you to study (if you suck at it like me) because she doesn't always use exact definitions on her tests.  She mostly uses examples like "if so-an

I actually didnt mind coming to her class...she is really funny and makes the material interesting to learn about.  If you study the lectures you should do reallly well on the test (always gives a page of bonus Q's and part of your final is take home)! i DEFINITELY reccommend her class

LOVE HER.....very sarcastic and witty...knows what she is talking about...attendance is not mandatory however she does expect you to show up ON TIME or she willnot let you in..test are somewhat easy..she does not give a study guide she expects you to know a lot for the test..VERY blunt but very funny..def will take her again..just make sure u study
